intro: Beloperone angustiflora, commonly known as the narrow-leaved beloperone, is a flowering plant native to certain regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many economically important plants such as coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its slender, lance-shaped leaves and small, clustered white flowers. It typically grows in shaded, moist environments within tropical forests. Its botanical features make it of interest to botanists and horticulturists studying plant diversity and adaptation.
